alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 12:55PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Monroe, east central Clarke and southwestern Wilcox Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 1255 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Frisco City, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vredenburgh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
